posts.name: Alexander Carlisi
posts.cooked:
Hello from 564!

PathPlanner has been working great for us, except for one big issue I haven’t been able to solve.

I am unsure if this is a fundamental issue with PathPlanner, or if I am registering the Commands incorrectly. Whenever I run the L2 Named Command which is registered as:

After the Command ends the PathPlannerAuto Path does not continue afterwards, and the Command is unscheduled.

My current theory is that PathPlanner cannot handle the Pose changing when running a NamedCommand. If that’s the case how are other teams scoring in PathPlanner, and is there a work around?

If that’s not the issue than I must be doing something wrong somewhere, please help me out!

Code Repository Link

posts.name: Sam Maier
posts.cooked: We had issues with deferred commands in PathPlanner - never dug much into it since it turned out we didn’t need to defer our one command. What happens if you do not defer this but instead register ReefRoutine directly?

posts.name: Chadfrom7226
posts.cooked:
Haven’t had an auto as complex as yours, but I see you have drivetrain as part of your command.

You can only run one command at a time for a subsystem. Is that conflicting with pathplanner?

posts.name: Alexander Carlisi
posts.cooked: I changed it, and it performed the same.

posts.name: Alexander Carlisi
posts.cooked: I removed the Drivetrain from the Command, but the Auto still cancels once it’s over.
It is very likely a subsystem requirements conflict.

We double checked to make sure that all of the commands in pathplanner had a definitive end condition  because our leds wouldn’t finish their command which stopped the whole auto until we changed the end condition for them

posts.name: Alexander Carlisi
posts.cooked: I split the Autos.ReefRoutine into different named commands and it fixed everything, I have no idea how
the old command was probably using the same subsytem for different commands at the same time which cancelled the auto
